column4: Hi! I'm a widnowsuser that is curious about installing linux, because I'm tired of all the problems in Windows
Could someone help me on the way?
Will you help me choosing the right distro please?
- If you're a  new refuge from Windows, you probably cannot do  better than Ubuntu
- 99.9% of the time, it "just works" and if you hit a snag, the community is great
- NTFS is a problem
- You're going to have some difficulties, if you cannot convert that external drive to Win32
- NTFS is going to be a limitation for you.
- I have run Windows as a virtual machine inside of Linux, using vmware
- Personally, I recomment Partition Magic... because I've never had a failure with it under Windows.
- Edu is for students.  Xubuntu is for freaks ;)  hehe.  Ubuntu or Kubuntu are the choices you should focus on.
- http://imageshack.us/
